clinical_study.brief_title: Multiple Breath Nitrogen Washout in Healthy and Cystic Fibrosis Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Multiple Breath Nitrogen Washout in Healthy and Cystic Fibrosis Adults: a Comparison of Two Commercially Available Devices

lead_sponsor.agency: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

clinical_study.source: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

brief_summary.textblock: This study compares the lung clearance index (LCI) in cystic fibrosis and healthy adults obtained with two different multiple breath nitrogen washout (MBWN2) devices. Each participants will perform the test (LCI) in duplicate on each device.

detailed_description.textblock: Using nitrogen as the inert gas, there are currently two commercially available devices that offer the possibility to measure the LCI. However, comparison between them are lacking. The 2 MBWN2 devices are the "EasyOne Pro Lab" (ndd Medical Technologies, Zürich, Switzerland) and the "Exhalyzer D" (Eco Medics AG, Duernten, Switzerland).

secondary_outcome.measure: Discriminative ability of LCI of each device (assessed by evaluating the proportion of patients with normal spirometry but high LCI with each device)
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in discriminative ability between devices will be assessed by evaluating the proportion of patients with normal spirometry but high LCI with each device

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional residual capacity (FRC) ( the helium rebreathing technique (FRC He) with a "Jaeger Masterscreen" (Würzburg, Germany)
secondary_outcome.description: FRC will be compared with a third device in a subset of 11 healthy adults : the helium rebreathing technique (FRC He) with a "Jaeger Masterscreen" (Würzburg, Germany)

other_outcome.description: Just after the completion of the tests, subjects will be asked to answer which one of the device they most preferred (i.e.: device A or device B or no preference).

arm_group.description: No treatment, comparison of LCI values obtained with two devices
No treatment, comparison of LCI values obtained with two devices Free of respiratory disease or others diseases likely to disturb respiratory system.

intervention.intervention_name: Comparison of two MBWN2 devices : "EasyOne Pro Lab" versus "Exhalyzer D"
intervention.description: Healthy and Cystic Fibrosis participants will perform the same day MBWN2 tests in duplicate with each device.

study_pop.textblock: CF : primary care clinic HC : community sample

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cystic fibrosis diagnosis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Respiratory infection within 3 weeks
- Chronically infected with methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus or Burkholderia Cepacia
